org.videolan.android.ui

Class GridFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • org.videolan.android.ui.GridFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SherlockGridFragment

    public class GridFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
    Copy a the static library support version of the framework's ListFragment, but then targeted for a GridView.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Provide default implementation to return a simple grid view. Subclasses can override to replace with their own layout. If doing so, the returned view hierarchy must have a GridView whose id is android.R.id.list and can optionally have a sibling view id android.R.id.empty that is to be shown when the list is empty.

        If you are overriding this method with your own custom content, consider including the standard layout R.layout.list_content in your layout file, so that you continue to retain all of the standard behavior of GridFragment. In particular, this is currently the only way to have the built-in indeterminant progress state be shown.

        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onGridItemClick

        public void onGridItemClick(android.widget.GridView gv,
                            android.view.View v,
                            int position,
                            long id)
        This method will be called when an item in the grid is selected. Subclasses should override. Subclasses can call getGridView().getItemAtPosition(position) if they need to access the data associated with the selected item.
        Parameters:
        gv - The GridView where the click happened
        v - The view that was clicked within the GridView
        position - The position of the view in the grid
        id - The row id of the item that was clicked

      • setEmptyText

        public void setEmptyText(java.lang.CharSequence text)
        The default content for a GridFragment has a TextView that can be shown when the grid is empty. If you would like to have it shown, call this method to supply the text it should use.

      • setGridShown

        public void setGridShown(boolean shown)
        Control whether the grid is being displayed. You can make it not displayed if you are waiting for the initial data to show in it. During this time an indeterminant progress indicator will be shown instead.

        Applications do not normally need to use this themselves. The default behavior of GridFragment is to start with the grid not being shown, only showing it once an adapter is given with setListAdapter(ListAdapter). If the grid at that point had not been shown, when it does get shown it will be do without the user ever seeing the hidden state.

        Parameters:
        shown - If true, the grid view is shown; if false, the progress indicator. The initial value is true.

      • setGridShownNoAnimation

        public void setGridShownNoAnimation(boolean shown)
        Like setGridShown(boolean), but no animation is used when transitioning from the previous state.

      • setGridShown

        private void setGridShown(boolean shown,
                          boolean animate)
        Control whether the grid is being displayed. You can make it not displayed if you are waiting for the initial data to show in it. During this time an indeterminant progress indicator will be shown instead.
        Parameters:
        shown - If true, the grid view is shown; if false, the progress indicator. The initial value is true.
        animate - If true, an animation will be used to transition to the new state.

      • getListAdapter

        public android.widget.ListAdapter getListAdapter()
        Get the ListAdapter associated with this activity's GridView.
